      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        A message is valid if all required fields are found in the message and the checksum value is correct. If true then the #getValidationErrorMessages() has one or more Exceptions explaining the problems with the message as reported by QuickFIX/J.
        Returns:
        true if the message is valid.

      • isIncoming

        public boolean isIncoming()

      • getSendingTime

        public java.util.Date getSendingTime()
        The sending time of the message. This value may be null if the SendingTime field is not found in the message. If the value is null then the #getValidationErrorMessages() contains an Exception describing the problem.
        Returns:
        the sending time of the message or null if the message was missing the sending time.

      • getLogFields

        public java.util.List<LogField> getLogFields()
        This method collects all Fields into a map. Each field is picked out of the raw message string and is looked up from the map. This ensures that we display the fields in the same order as the raw message string. Why? Because the message class does not provide a way to get the fields in the sent order. The only time we care about the field order is when logging. This method executes on the Event Dispatch Thread, so we are not slowing down the quickfix thread. This object does not cache the field objects. Each invocation of this method creates a new list of LogField objects. This is done so that memory utilization is kept low. The caller should clear the returned list when it is finished with the values. The typical caller would clear the list when a new message is displayed. In fact, this is exactly what the org.opentradingsolutions.log4fix.ui.messages.ViewModel does.
        Returns:
        locally created List of LogField objects; not a cached value.
